section.description: Use CSS syntax e.g. 200px, 2in, etc. You can also specify the width as :flex(<number>), for example flex(1), flex(2). Flex columns automatically grow to consume the available remaining space. If you only have one 'flex' column, the number you specify is irrelevant. If you have more than one 'flex' column, the number is the relative size. For example, say you have 4 columns with these widths: 1in, flex(1), flex(2), 2in. Say the list width is 10in. The flex width columns in total will be 7in (10-3). The flex(1) column will be 7/3in and the second 'flex' column will be 14/3in (i.e twice the width of the first 'flex' column).
